question.title: Will the S&P 500 close above 6000 today?

research.synthesis:
**S&P 500 (^GSPC) Status (Jan 7, 2026, intraday ~2:40 PM ET):**  
Current price: 6945.74 (+0.92, +0.013% from prev close 6944.82). Day range: 6936.58-6965.69. Volume: ~1.96B shares. SPY ETF: 691.96 (+0.02%). VIX: 14.99 (+1.63%), indicating low volatility.

**Context from Prior Day (Jan 6):** Barron's/CNBC reports confirm S&P hit record close, Dow >49k. No major negative catalysts; small-caps surged, oil volatile on Venezuela news, but equities resilient.

**Forecast Insight:** Already ~15.8% above 6000 threshold mid-session with minimal volatility (VIX <15). Afternoon drop to <6000 (~13-14% plunge) highly improbable absent crash event. Implied prob >99%.

research.formatted_for_forecaster:
=== RESEARCH SYNTHESIS ===
**S&P 500 (^GSPC) Status (Jan 7, 2026, intraday ~2:40 PM ET):**  
Current price: 6945.74 (+0.92, +0.013% from prev close 6944.82). Day range: 6936.58-6965.69. Volume: ~1.96B shares. SPY ETF: 691.96 (+0.02%). VIX: 14.99 (+1.63%), indicating low volatility.

**Context from Prior Day (Jan 6):** Barron's/CNBC reports confirm S&P hit record close, Dow >49k. No major negative catalysts; small-caps surged, oil volatile on Venezuela news, but equities resilient.

**Forecast Insight:** Already ~15.8% above 6000 threshold mid-session with minimal volatility (VIX <15). Afternoon drop to <6000 (~13-14% plunge) highly improbable absent crash event. Implied prob >99%.

=== SEARCH RESULTS ===
